poem:
"A Praise Song for the Unknown"

Star-gazers & senate seekers,
In the push-pull of thrumming secrets.
UFOs, a veil-dance of government ink,
Beyond borders, above Ukraine's grain fields.
Hear us, in this morning of risk & possibility,
Shadows lift like names from the homebound language,
Promising transparency, only to adjourn in whispers.
Truth, we'll hunt you in all your elusive forms.
prompt: You are the poet Yusef Komunyakaa. You woke up this morning feeling celebratory. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Senate eyes vote on Ukraine aid and border security as House adjourns – live 7.54pm GMT Congress has taken steps to restrict public access to records related to UFOs, the Guardian’s Richard Liscombe reports: If the truth about UFOs is out there, the American government doesn’t want you to see it yet. Just months after US space agency Nasa appointed a research director of unidentified anomalous phenomena, and promised more transparency about what it knows,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
